page.title: 01Macaroni Downs Farm.
page.content: This is an area of Cotswold farmland, primarily under cereal production, but where the fluvio-glacial valleys of the river Leach occur, steeply rolling banks of grassland provide dramatic landscapes & grazing usually for sheep. These slopes are beloved by the local hunt, lone walkers & winter tobogganers. In the southern portion the scattered copses, primarily of beech, enhance the panorama as well as providing good cover for pheasant & partridge. The fields are bounded by dry stone walls which are expensive to maintain & no longer stockproof. The farmhouses, cottages & older barns all use the local limestone, but recent & probably transient agricultural buildings are constructed with corrugated tin & asbestos roofing. Only three of the five farm houses are lived in by farming families.
